direction.raw_text: A cockpit for three. Neptune's blue light fills the chamber, reflects off immobile particles in the air. Thick quartz windows look down at Neptune. The cockpit lights are dark but for one blinking red light. An emergency beacon. Under-floor lights go on. The strobe of the red light reveals a man floating at the helm, slowly spinning. He is dead, perfectly preserved in the cold vacuum of space. His eyes are empty black pits and his mouth hangs open in a scream: DR. WILLIAM WEIR.
direction.name: direction

(beat) Houston wants Aerospace to send out a search and rescue team, investigate the source of the transmission. If it really is the Event Horizon, they'll attempt a salvage. (beat) We need you to prepare a detailed briefing on the ship's systems for the salvage crew...

dialogue.raw_text: What was made public about the Event Horizon, that she was a deep space research vessel, that its reactor went critical, that the ship blew up... None of that is true. (beat) The Event Horizon was the culmination of a secret government project to create a spacecraft capable of faster- than-light flight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The law of relativity prohibits faster- than-light travel...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relativity, yes. We can't break the law of relativity, but we can go around it. The ship doesn't really move faster than the speed of light; it creates a dimensional gateway that allows the ship to instantaneously "jump" from one point in the universe to another, light years away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, in layman's terms, you use a rotating magnetic field to focus a narrow beam of gravitons; these in turn fold space-time consistent with Weyl tensor dynamics until the space- time curvature becomes infinitely large and you have a singularity...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Laymen's terms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey...

dialogue.raw_text: Say this paper represents space-time, and you want to get from "point A" here... (marks it on the photo with a pen) ...to "point B," here. (marks point B) Now: what's the shortest distance between two points?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A straight line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wrong. The shortest distance between two points...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...is zero. That's what the singularity does: it folds space, so that point A and point B coexist in the same space and time. After the ship passes through this gateway, space returns to normal. (hands the ruined pin- up back to Smith) It's called a gravity drive.

dialogue.raw_text: It was the ship's maiden voyage, to test the drive. The Event Horizon moved to safe distance using ion thrusters. They received the go-ahead to activate the gravity drive. (beat) And the ship vanished from all our scopes. No radar contact, no enhanced optical, no radio contact of any kind. They disappeared without a trace. (beat) Until now.

WALL BEHIND PETERS, CASED IN A FROZEN EXPLOSION OF BLOOD AND TISSUE

direction.raw_text: R AS A FLASH OF BLUE LIGHTNING ILLUMINATES THE ROOM, REVEALING... ...THE WALL BEHIND PETERS, CASED IN A FROZEN EXPLOSION OF BLOOD AND TISSUE. Someone died here in a violent and terrible way. Peters starts to look up but the flash dies away. She never saw the horror behind her. Peters turns her attention back to her tiny crystal. She traps the it, returns the container to her belt. She moves from the antechamber into...

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what happened to the Tower of Babel, don't you? It fell down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're sucking too much nitrogen in your mix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Starck programs the sensor workstation. She glances over at Weir: sitting at a computer terminal, his face rapt as data flashes by. His lips move, muttering to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir keeps his attention focused on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fingers fly across the keyboard, double-checking the data. Miller leans over Weir's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The INTERCOM interrupts them:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why Dr. Weir, I think you're in love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmmm. Claire used to tell me I loved the Event Horizon more than I loved her. I told her that wasn't true, I just knew the Event Horizon better, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Claire is your wife?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It must be hard, being so far away from her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I miss her. She died. Two years now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These things happen. (reacting to something on the screen) Wait a minute, that's not right...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have something, Dr. Weir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The date.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Event Horizon's computer think's it's 2034.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Exactly. The ship's internal clock is off by seven years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe a power interruption crashed the system...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, there's no evidence of a surge or spike of any kind. It's as if time just... stopped for seven years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Explanation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Intense gravitational fields effect the passage of time, it's possible... (beat) Black holes make sense on paper, it's all math, you see, but as to what really happened... (he shakes his head) The Event Horizon has passed beyond our plane of reality, and like Lazarus, returned from the dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (intercom) Captain Miller, Dr. Weir? I found the final log entry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Peters sits at the workstation. Miller, DJ and Weir stand behind her, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENT HORIZON - GRAVITY COUCH BAY (FOR VIDEO) A jumpy, handheld camera view of: Gravity couch bay. Two crewmen checking electronics modules. The ship is well-lit, clean, no sign of debris. The narrator's voice is excited and nervous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) We have reached safe distance and are preparing to engage the gravity drive and open the gateway...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The speaker is the mission commander...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quiet) John Kilpack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Second Containment. A lone engineer finishes his check of the Core. He turns to the camera and gives a self-conscious "thumbs-up."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) When you get this message, God willing, we will reach the solar system of Proxima Centauri...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I wonder if they ever made it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corridor. The entire original crew assembled, playing catch with the stuffed dog
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I just want to say how proud I am of my crew. I'd like to name my station heads Chris Chambers, Janice Rubin, Dick Smith, Tom Fender and Stacie Collins. And to Bill Weir and all the scientists that got us here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bridge. KILPACK addresses the camera. His face is flushed with excitement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... uh, I had something historic to say, and I wrote it down but I... I can't find it. Ave, atque, vale. Hail and farewell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of static... ...followed by an inhuman HOWL of FEEDBACK, like screaming hyaenas, almost alive. Through the swirl of static, the suggestion of movement. Miller freezes the frame. He squints at the screen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MILLER Obscured by static, the image is blurred beyond comprehension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, the lights fade out. Dim emergency lighting snaps on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Weir has vanished into the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller follows after Weir.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is that? Dr. Weir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can run the image through a series of filters, try to clean it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's happening...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A power drain -- MILLER We barely have enough power for life support as it is, if we can't stop the drain, we're not gonna make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Core...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The rest of you, stay here, I don't want anyone else going near that thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Second Containment Seal opens. Weir is about to enter when Miller stops him. He checks a Geiger counter. It is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir crosses to a console. Frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller assists Weir in removing bolts from an access panel. The panel falls away, revealing a cramped duct leading into the ship's circuitry. Weir climbs into the duct. Miller hands him a flashlight and a toolkit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir begins to crawl into the depths of the ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No radiation. What's causing the drain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) The magnetic fields are holding. Maybe a short in the fail-safe circuit. I'll check it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't get the power back, our air's gonna go bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check the Core for radiation. Carbon dioxide may be the least of our worries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Weir's breath ECHOES in the cramped shaft. He counts off circuit panels as he goes:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: E-three... E-five... E-seven... where are you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Miller slogs through the coolant to the Core. Stares at it. It remains metallic, mundane. He pulls out a Geiger counter and crosses to the reactor shell. Examines a gleaming weld. The Geiger counter CLICKS slowly: no leak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A yellow light starts flashing on the engineering board. Starck's eyes widen: the engineering sections flash yellow...and green...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the bio-scan goes wild.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into intercom) Skipper, the bio-scan just went off the scale...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Justin shakes on the bed in an epileptic fit. DJ rushes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justin's eyes remain unfocused, unseeing as he tries to speak.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Justin! Can you hear me? Justin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leans in close, trying to hear him speak... Justin arches in agony and the words come in a strangled, tortured voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir stops before module E-12. Hears a faint HISSING and POPPING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He uses a screwdriver to open up the module. Reveals a series of circuit boards. One SPARKS. Weir plucks the damaged chips and starts running a by-pass. His flashlight flickers. He bangs it against the duct wall. It grows dimmer. Goes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A single DRIP of water in the darkness...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another DRIP, then a woman's VOICE like a distant echo:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir starts at the sound. He recognizes the voice. She speaks again, no longer far away, but a close WHISPER in his ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir's eyes open wide in hope and fear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um. Captain Miller? I, uh, I seem to have a problem with my light.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat, hushed) Captain Miller?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Billy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Billy. Help me. I'm so cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Even the emergency lights go out. Total darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller's voice trails off as he looks towards the Core. A red glow reflects across his eyes. He takes a few steps away from the reactor. He stares... ...at the BURNING MAN, standing before the Core. The deep ROAR of its conflagration fills the containment. It slowly turns and raises its arm and points at Miller in accusation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller stares as the Burning Man turns and vanishes into a bulkhead, leaving the wall blackened and burned with his passing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We just lost all power in here. Dr. Weir...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't leave me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Total darkness. Weir's breath ECHOES in the cramped metal space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir bangs his flashlight. Again. Again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flashlight flickers... Claire's face is inches from Weir's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His flashlight flickers again, snaps on... She is gone. Weir lets his head fall to the floor of the deck, breathing in ragged SOBS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a whisper) Claire...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Help me. I'm so cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The crew, except for Cooper. DJ whets a scalpel against the leg of his jumpsuit, an unconscious gesture. FLICK. FLICK. FLICK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All heads turn to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She falls silent, unwilling to say more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smith, leaning against the doorway:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir's face is stone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Carbon dioxide poisoning produces hallucinations, impaired judgement...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddammit, DJ, it was not a hallucination! I saw a man, he was on fire. And then he disappeared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe one of the original crew?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. It was someone else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring the question) Dr. Weir, you were right there, you must have heard something, seen something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I saw nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About an hour ago. In medical. I saw my son. He was lying on one of the examination tables and his legs were... (she trails off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't it possible that you were traumatized by finding the body on the bridge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've seen bodies before. This is different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peters is right. Its like something reaching into your mind. Seeing your thoughts and making them real. Smith, did you or Cooper experience anything unusual?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't see anything and I don't have to see anything. This ship is fucked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for that scientific analysis, Mister Smith.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exploding) Hey! You don't need to be a scientist figure it out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smith...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...you break all the laws of physics, you think there won't be a price? You already killed the first crew...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's enough!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lays one hand on Smith's shoulder to calm him... Smith reacts violently, turning on DJ, shoving him back. DJ uses Smith's momentum to spin the pilot into the wall. He presses his scalpel just below Smith's ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: freezes. The scalpel falls from his hands. He releases Smith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smith goes for Weir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller heads him off, grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smith calms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smith leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller exits. Starck follows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, I... I don't know why I did that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wry) Carbon dioxide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's fucking lying, you know something...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it, that's enough for one day, Smith! I need you back on the Clark, I need you calm, I need you using your head, you make a mistake out there, none of are getting home, you understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get outside, go back to work. I'll join you shortly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're a long way from home and we're in a bad place. Let's not make it worse. If anyone has any constructive suggestions, now is the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I can stabilize the fields around the singularity, that should prevent another power drain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To conserve our oxygen, we should severely restrict our activity. Anyone who can should get some sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need sleep, DJ. I need answers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Miller stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller starts walking again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rushes to follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miller...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not slowing) What is it, Starck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I ran the bio-scan with the DNA/RNA filter. The results were bio-readings of indeterminate origin...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (simultaneous)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...bio-readings of indeterminate origin," don't you have anything useful to tell me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got a theory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was a another surge in the bio- readings right before you... you saw what you saw. We picked up a similar readings right before the Clarke was damaged. What if there were a connection between the two? The gravity waves, the hallucination, all part of an defensive reaction, like an immune system...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need to hear this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . 2 Miller and Starck enter the Airlock Bay:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She grabs him by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Miller allows himself to relax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller pulls an EVA suit from the wall, starts putting it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods. He locks his helmet into place.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to listen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To what? What are you saying? This ship is alive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't say that, I said the bio- readings correspond to what happened to you, the ship is reacting to us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're hanging on by our fingernails and you're giving me bullshit stories...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not bullshit, it's the only conclusion the data supports...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Starck, do you know how crazy that sounds? It's impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you knew it was impossible, then why'd you waste my time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you wanted an answer. And that's the only one I have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I want is to survive the next ten hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (checks her watch) Nine hours and twenty-two minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going outside to work on the Clark. And Starck... don't tell anyone what you just told me. We've got enough to worry about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Establish.

direction.raw_text: The ship seems to breathe. The lights flicker...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The ship seems to breathe. The lights flicker...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The ship seems to breathe. The lights flicker...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peters has fallen asleep in her chair. On the threshold of hearing, a distant POUNDING. Not a heartbeat. Metal on metal. Something trying to get out. Something trying to get in. Peters wakes with a start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns. Justin lies on the floor in a heap, completely covered by his sheet. She crosses to him. Pulls back the sheet... Revealing empty nitrogen tanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up, eyes widening, as... The IV bottles fill with blood. Blood fills the X-ray lightboxes, it surges up from gutters in the floor... And the pounding grows louder... LOUDER... almost to Medical... The spell breaks and she RUNS...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Justin...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Justin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Peters sprints, the SOUND BOOMING after her, almost on her heels...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peters darts into the Bridge Antechamber. She SLAMS the pressure door shut behind her, CUTTING OFF the sound. She turns. Weir, DJ, Starck look up from their work, staring at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Peters starts to LAUGH, part hysteria, part relief.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't hear it? You must have heard it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heard what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: crosses to Peters, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he reaches out to touch her...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BOOM. BOOM. POUNDING ON THE DOOR ITSELF Peters SCREAMS. DJ clutches her to him, backs away from the door. The POUNDING grows louder. LOUDER. The door vibrates with each blow Starck puts her hands over her ears. Peters SCREAMS at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the POUNDING intensifies, metal GROANING under incredible pressure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir slowly walks to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starck grabs him. He tries to shake her off, but she traps his arm in a wrist-lock. He turns on her, his face furious... ...and the POUNDING stops. They remain frozen for a moment. Afraid to breathe. Weir shakes the trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distance, the POUNDING begins again. Moving away from them. The ship systems station BEEPS. A warning light flashes on the console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peters, Starck and DJ rush from the Bridge, leaving Weir behind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it! Stop it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting to be heard) What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wants me. I have to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In our current environment, Dr. Weir, self-control is an asset.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm alright. Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The forward airlock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) Miller, Smith, Cooper, any of you in the airlock?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (radio) That's a negative, Starck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (realization) Justin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 3 They race into the bay even as Justin steps into the Airlock. He is naked.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Justin, no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . 3 Justin turns and stares through them with cold eyes. He reaches out to the airlock control. The pressure door shuts with a HISS.

dialogue.raw_text: We'll have to re-route through the port conduit to the APU.

dialogue.raw_text: What about the accumulator...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (radio) Miller, come in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on in there, Starck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (radio) Justin's in the airlock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . 3 Starck at the intercom. The others huddle by the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (intercom) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's awake, he's in the airlock, he's not wearing a suit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (to Cooper) Stay here! Don't stop working!

dialogue.raw_text: But Justin...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get him.

dialogue.raw_text: He's engaged the override.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you shut it down?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll try. DJ, you better get your bag of tricks.

dialogue.raw_text: Justin! Open the door!

dialogue.raw_text: (muffled) The door, Justin! Open the door!

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Yes, Justin, we heard it.

dialogue.raw_text: Keep him talking.

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know what it was?

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (intercom) What, Justin, what shows you?

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (intercom) It won't stop, it goes on and on and on...

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (intercom) What does?

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (intercom) The dark inside me.

direction.raw_text: escapes Weir's lips. He cradles his head in his hands.

direction.raw_text: Miller gets to all fours, trying to get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir kicks Miller savagely. Miller slides through the coolant, comes to rest beneath a walkway. He attempts to rise, collapses back into the sludge. Weir slowly stalks towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weir's grotesque face is inches from his. He reaches down and pulls Miller from the dripping ooze...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...as Miller clears the surface, he holds something in his fist. Miller stares dead-on into Weir's hellish face... ...and raises his right hand. HE'S HOLDING THE DETONATOR.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You can't have them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not the Devil. I'm much, much older. I watched the Beginning and I will see the End. I am the dark behind the stars. I am the dark inside you all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...not the Devil...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is no Devil. There is no God. There is only... NOTHING.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're lying...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not asking you to believe me. You'll see for yourself... and so will your crew. You're all coming with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Starck... Cooper...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They are mine. And so are you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a grim smile of triumph) You can't have them. Go to hell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A small, silent EXPLOSION blossoms in the aft section of the ship...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...followed frames later by a sequence of DETONATIONS that rip the Main Access Corridor apart and propel the foredecks away from the containment section.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The EXPLOSION knocks Starck and Cooper down. They hold on tightly as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waves of distortion ripple over the Event Horizon's containment section... A dark sphere of energy spreads out from the containment as the gateway opens... A BLACK HOLE... The black hole begins to shrink, imploding. As it collapses, it sucks Neptune's blue clouds with it, creating a TITANIC WHIRLPOOL with the black hole at its center... The SHRIEKING winds carry the foredecks back towards the whirlpool, towards the black hole...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cooper and Starck slide across the floor as the deck tips at a terrific angle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The foredecks teeter on the edge of oblivion... The black hole collapses utterly, vanishing to a point. An enormous SHOCKWAVE rips out from the point of implosion. The foredecks ride the wave away from the implosion and out of Neptune's atmosphere to safety...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The VIBRATIONS subside. Cooper and Starck stagger to their feet. Look out the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neptune recedes, the ugly hole of the implosion already being erased by Neptune's violent winds...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starck's voice is tiny.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miller...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MODEL Black planets silhouetted by a dying red giant. The Engineering Containment of the Event Horizon drifts in the eddies of gas that swirl and spiral into the bloated star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: towards the ship until its shadow consumes all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENT HORIZON - GRAVITY COUCH BAY Starck awakens but the SCREAMS continue as the Event Horizon calls out to her... she SCREAMS... hands on her body... the CRIES stop... Starck looks around uncomprehending at the faces around her.
direction.name: direction
